text: They don’t want you to learn the true meaning of degeneracy (a subset of measure zero)
I’m not sure anyone has figured out the healthy way to deal with the tremendous amount of (natural/warranted) guilt that comes with being born privileged
no I really don’t deserve to be here more than that kid who put 1000 hours studying the IIT. He would’ve done a lot better in life with that willpower in my position
same with when I disadvantaged kids in EECS/adjacent e.g. paying their own tuition, rent. My path here is about 100x easier and my mental burden is so much less
The easy RW mindset is “you basically deserve what’s been given to you and people who struggle deserve that too” and that’s cringe
On the other hand, white guilt or idk male feminists are also obviously not perspectives to align yourself with

It’s tempting to answer these questions with essentially sophistry:
- if it was possible for someone more worthy than you to take advantage of your position, it would happen, but equity is an anti-entropic process
- the notion of “more worthy” is fake
- you are aligned with the notion of being sufficiently helpful, + the fact that you’re obviously smart; you’re probably in the 99th percentile of people deserving of EECS at UC of B
I’m not sure if you were even struggling with this precise thing this thread is very much for me; I have two midterms tomorrow!
